page.title: 01The Coolham and Shipley Area
page.content: This rural, mainly undeveloped area, bordered on the north by the main A272 trunk road is situated in the heart of the Sussex Weald. Its population is centred on Coolham at the north west boundary and the ancient, picturesque village of Shipley in the middle of the block. With views of Chanctonbury Ring on the South Downs, the typically Wealden area of low lying, flat, fertile, agricultural clay is drained by many ditches flowing into the River Adur and its tributaries. Ditches, hawthorn hedges and Wealden oak trees bound fields and roadside verges. Historical associations range from the Romans and Normans to a World War II airfield. The area contains buildings linked with William Penn, Hilaire Belloc and others, and reference to it occurs in the original Domesday Book.
